DOC.brief_title: Massage To Improve Uterine Artery Blood Flow
DOC.detailed_description: Prenatal depression associate adverse neonatal outcome include preterm birth low birthweight . Potential underlying mechanism prenatal depression effect prematurity low birthweight involve elevate sympathetic nervous system SNS Hypothalamic Pituitary Adrenal HPA Axis function note depressed pregnant woman . These may lead increase uterine artery resistance result limited blood flow , oxygen nutrient fetus . Moderate pressure massage therapy may reduce problem depress pregnant woman decrease SNS HPA axis function , result decreased uterine artery resistance , increase oxygen nutrient fetus low prematurity low birthweight . An alternative model explore moderate pressure massage may increase progesterone/estriol ratio , counteract negative cortisol effect gestational age . Eighty pregnant woman depression symptom recruit approximately 20 week gestation randomly assign moderate pressure massage therapy SHAM light pressure massage touch/attention control group . The woman receive 20-minute weekly massage therapy session 20 30 week gestation . At 20 30 week gestation , depress symptom assess use CES-D , saliva sample collect assay alpha amylase SNS marker , cortisol HPA axis marker progesterone estriol level . Maternal Doppler ultrasound conduct assess uterine artery resistance index estimate uterine artery blood flow . Upon delivery , mother ' medical chart review record gestational age birthweight . The investigator hypothesize moderate pressure massage group elicit increase progesterone/estriol ratios decrease alpha amylase cortisol level , turn lead reduce uterine artery resistance low incidence prematurity low birthweight .
DOC.criteria: Uncomplicated singleton pregnancy Depression < 20 week GA recruitment Pregnancy complication HIV Smoking , drug use
